# Question

You are given a list of daily temperature data `temps` (numbers). Write a function `weather_data_analyzer` that performs statistical analyses on this data (use `Statistics` package). The function should return results in named tuple (construct it with `(; key1=value1,key2=value2)` syntax) containing the `average`, `max`, `min` temperatures, and a `trend` (can be only: `:increasing`, `:decreasing`, or `:stable`). If the list is empty, the function should return a named tuple with all values set to `nothing`.

Examples:
```julia
weather_data_analyzer([21.5, 18.0, 17.4]) # (; average=20.033333333333336, max=21.5, min=17.4, trend=:decreasing)
weather_data_analyzer([18.5, 19.8, 20.7]) # (; average=19.533333333333336, max=20.7, min=18.5, trend=:increasing)
weather_data_analyzer([17.8, 17.6, 17.7]) # (; average=17.666666666666668, max=17.8, min=17.6, trend=:stable)
weather_data_analyzer([19.0, 20.5, 23.1, 23.4]) # (; average=21.175, max=23.4, min=19.0, trend=:increasing)
```

### Answer
```julia
using Statistics
function weather_data_analyzer(temps::Vector{T} where T <: Real)
    if isempty(temps)
        return (; average = nothing, max = nothing, min = nothing, trend = nothing)
    elseif length(temps) == 1
        return (; average = temps[1], max = temps[1], min = temps[1], trend = :stable)
    end

    avg, maxi, mini = mean(temps), maximum(temps), minimum(temps)

    if issorted(temps) && temps[end] - temps[1] >= 0.5
        return (; average=avg, max=maxi, min=mini, trend=:increasing)
    elseif issorted(temps) && temps[end] - temps[1] <= -0.5
        return (; average=avg, max=maxi, min=mini, trend=:decreasing)
    end

    return (; average=avg, max=maxi, min=mini, trend=:stable)
end
```
